docs.text: Open Integration ¶ Open-Integration is a pipeline framework that allows to write (golang) powerful pipelines, then the pipeline is compiled into single binary to be executed elsewhere. Why? ¶ A pipeline, wether its CI, CD, ETL and any other binding between multiple API's is most of the time 2 parts entity: 1. The pipeline engine 2. The pipeline spec Its hard to test Its hard to run locally Required knowledge of providers pipeline spec Well besicaly its once again the big debate code vs config
